pr_title: Cosmos: preview for a more detailed CFP state reporting

timeline.message: Add preview implementation for a more detailed lag estimator.

timeline.bodyText:
This would need to be of type FeedRange soon. https://github.com/FabianMeiswinkel/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/cosmos/azure-cosmos/src/main/java/com/azure/cosmos/models/FeedRange.java
I think we have 3 Options:

Keep it String here, to avoid breaking change use the FeedRange.toSjon as the value and expect customers to do the transformations upstream
Make a breaking change to this preview contract when I merge the FeedRange changes - would probably be good to set expectations with Walmart that we expect some breaking changes here
Add FeedRange as an additional field - make Id the FeedRange.toJson() - this way it doesn't break and the Id might not be very useful anymore but also doesn't really cause harm

I think 3) is an acceptable solution - le me know whether you agree/disagree
timeline.author: FabianMeiswinkel

replies.bodyText:
The ID here is just a regular unique identifier for the lease document inside the lease collection. In the CFP "push" case we can have multiple independent instances operating on the same feed container and possibly sharing the same lease container to check-point the state; to differentiate between then a "lease prefix' is being used.
Regarding the FeedRage, I thin that will more or less matches the lease token which defines the actual scope of a single worker which will process the feeds.
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.bodyText: NIT: final static "consts" as class level to avoid allocation for every execution
timeline.author: FabianMeiswinkel

replies.bodyText: yep, makes sense since these are also shared in the code above.
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.author: FabianMeiswinkel

replies.bodyText: Same for several of the local variables below
replies.author: FabianMeiswinkel

replies.bodyText:
Though these have one assignment, it will look a bit odd when compared with similar patterns in the rest of the implementation (not just CFP).
And since they are not consumed by any Reactor code as arguments down the execution path which requires as such, they don't really need to be final...
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.bodyText: NIT: assign local variable for feedResponse.getResults() to avoid repetitive invocation of the property getter
timeline.author: FabianMeiswinkel

replies.bodyText: I'll keep it as such, it is easier to read the code. The property getter does not execute any particular complex operation, it just returns an internal member.
replies.author: milismsft

replies.bodyText: also java compiler may inline these. so shouldn't be a perf hit.
replies.author: moderakh

timeline.bodyText:
Not sure - my style-preference would be
changeFeedProcessorState
.setEstimatedLag(0)
.setContinuationToken(latestLsn);
But feel free to ignore if the non-fluent style is what makes the code more consistent etc.
timeline.author: FabianMeiswinkel

replies.bodyText: I agree, this should be fluent style - if changeFeedProcessorState supports it.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: In general I prefer the same "fluidity", especially after invoking the constructor :-)
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.bodyText: Wouldn't this indicate a critical failure - tracing as warning and ignoring unexpected backend response seems to make it harder than necessary to identify breaking changes / debug it?
timeline.author: FabianMeiswinkel

replies.bodyText: _ts should always be a long - right ?
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: The error though unexpected (_ts system property is an epoch), it is not fatal (there's a log warning capturing this). Setting the continuation token as "null" is an indicator that the document found is not valid; i.e. we initialized CFP leases but we are yet to process any changes in this particular scope/partition.
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.bodyText: Again - feel free to ignore for consistency etc. - I am still struggling with Java not having a clear way to distinguish ReadOnlyList in the contract. But form my intuition I would expect it to be clearly documented in the Api doc comments if a method returns an unmodifiable list - so would it make sense to add a comment along tehse lines above? Also wouldn't it make sense to also return an unmodifiable list in the short-cut - when the list is empty) above to be consistent?
timeline.author: FabianMeiswinkel

replies.bodyText: yep, I've updated the doc to capture this is a read only list.
replies.author: milismsft

replies.bodyText: also fixed the empty list early returned case (thanks for catching that up).
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.bodyText: Nice - thanks for taking care of this :-)
timeline.author: FabianMeiswinkel

timeline.bodyText:
Capturing the comment from above...
This would need to be of type FeedRange soon. https://github.com/FabianMeiswinkel/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/cosmos/azure-cosmos/src/main/java/com/azure/cosmos/models/FeedRange.java
I think we have 3 Options:
Keep it String here, to avoid breaking change use the FeedRange.toSjon as the value and expect customers to do the transformations upstream
Make a breaking change to this preview contract when I merge the FeedRange changes - would probably be good to set expectations with Walmart that we expect some breaking changes here
Add FeedRange as an additional field - make Id the FeedRange.toJson() - this way it doesn't break and the Id might not be very useful anymore but also doesn't really cause harm
I think 3) is an acceptable solution - le me know whether you agree/disagree
timeline.author: milismsft

replies.bodyText:
The lease token can be any string representing one scope for a CFP worker to operate on, including a JSON string if we want to. It will be TBD how we store it in the lease document/item to make it persistent but from the user's perspective it should not matter much since FeedRange already has a constructor that takes a string payload.
We can also consider adding a "version" property to distinguish between different implementations if that helps.
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.bodyText: String.split(.) uses regex (CPU intensive), Use StringUtils.split instead
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: fixed
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.bodyText:
String.split uses regex underneath which is cpu intensive.
use StringUtils.split instead.

replies.bodyText: fixed
replies.author: milismsft

replies.bodyText: isn't that implicit given the return type?

replies.bodyText: well, IMO the api method name should speak for itself without looking at the return type.

replies.bodyText: np, I can make that change

timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: same, given the argument type isn't that "Time" part implicit?

replies.bodyText: fixed
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.message: use StringUtils.split() instead of regular split.
Update the CFP estimator to also capture the latest token (see session token) which represent the newest created or updated item.

timeline.bodyText:
_ts is implementation detail. And it might get impacted by the clock skews on service side.
Its better for any application to not take dependency on this concept/value.
timeline.author: kirankumarkolli

replies.bodyText: I will take it out; it's not needed for the customer scenario we want to enable as preview.
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.message: remove the system time from the state being reported
